alert.note: Alert for Juniata (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN JUNIATA AND WEST CENTRAL PERRY COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 154 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles south of Lewistown, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Honey Grove, Spruce Hill, East Waterford and Perulack. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central and south central Pennsylvania.
